citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The nesting boxes within the bird enclosure housing 12 chickens and 4 peafowl are not being cleaned as often as
necessary to prevent excessive accumulation of feces and food waste. Within the sheltered coop, there are a series of
nest boxes available for the poultry that have accumulations of fecal matter, shavings, egg shells, and debris inside. One
box has clear, gelatinous liquid sitting in the front left corner of the box, potentially egg white from the broken egg shells
present. Boxes with accumulation of food waste and fecal matter can lead to soiling of the birds if they choose to use the
next boxes along with an increased risk of disease hazards, insects, pests, and odors. Correct by 11 July 2025 by
ensuring excreta and food waste are being removed from primary enclosures as frequently as necessary to prevent
excess accumulation of feces and food waste, to prevent soiling of the birds contained within the primary enclosures, and
to reduce disease hazards, insects, pests and odors.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the manager.
n

narrative:
3.158(a)(1) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
The nesting boxes within the bird enclosure housing 12 chickens and 4 peafowl are not being cleaned as often as 
necessary to prevent excessive accumulation of feces and food waste. Within the sheltered coop, there are a series of 
nest boxes available for the poultry that have accumulations of fecal matter, shavings, egg shells, and debris inside. One 
box has clear, gelatinous liquid sitting in the front left corner of the box, potentially egg white from the broken egg shells 
present. Boxes with accumulation of food waste and fecal matter can lead to soiling of the birds if they choose to use the 
next boxes along with an increased risk of disease hazards, insects, pests, and odors. Correct by 11 July 2025 by 
ensuring excreta and food waste are being removed from primary enclosures as frequently as necessary to prevent 
excess accumulation of feces and food waste, to prevent soiling of the birds contained within the primary enclosures, and 
to reduce disease hazards, insects, pests and odors. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the manager. 
 
 n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
